intro: Mesembryanthemum tenue, commonly known as the narrowleaf ice plant, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its fleshy, blue-green leaves that are covered in fine, white hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid environments. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink, red, or white, typically blooming in spring and summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Its ability to store water in its leaves allows it to survive in drought conditions.
